channel.title: Help-Half Stats are red and half are white
channel.description: i want to know how to change the color to all white instead of having red 99 over a white 99...i want it 99/99 all white..if you can help please do!

item.title: Help-Half Stats are red and half are white
item.dc:creator: @Baybee Baybee
item.description:
@Baybee wrote:

Open Client.java.
Search public void DeadStats() {

You will see this…

[code]playerLevel[0] = getLevelForXP(playerXP[0]);
sendFrame126("@whi@"+getLevelForXP(playerXP[0])+"", 4004);
sendFrame126("@whi@"+getLevelForXP(playerXP[0])+"", 4005);

playerLevel[1] = getLevelForXP(playerXP[1]);
sendFrame126("@whi@"+getLevelForXP(playerXP[1])+"", 4008);
sendFrame126("@whi@"+getLevelForXP(playerXP[1])+"", 4009);

        playerLevel[2] = getLevelForXP(playerXP[2]);
sendFrame126("@whi@"+getLevelForXP(playerXP[2])+"", 4006);
sendFrame126("@whi@"+getLevelForXP(playerXP[2])+"", 4007);

        playerLevel[3] = getLevelForXP(playerXP[3]);
sendFrame126("@whi@"+getLevelForXP(playerXP[3])+"", 4016);
sendFrame126("@whi@"+getLevelForXP(playerXP[3])+"", 4017);

        playerLevel[4] = getLevelForXP(playerXP[4]);
sendFrame126("@whi@"+getLevelForXP(playerXP[4])+"", 4010);
sendFrame126("@whi@"+getLevelForXP(playerXP[4])+"", 4011);

        playerLevel[5] = getLevelForXP(playerXP[5]);
sendFrame126("@whi@"+getLevelForXP(playerXP[5])+"", 4012);
sendFrame126("@whi@"+getLevelForXP(playerXP[5])+"", 4013);

        playerLevel[6] = getLevelForXP(playerXP[6]);
  	    sendFrame126("@whi@"+getLevelForXP(playerXP[6])+"", 4014);
    sendFrame126("@whi@"+getLevelForXP(playerXP[6])+"", 4015);

        playerLevel[7] = getLevelForXP(playerXP[7]);
sendFrame126("@whi@"+getLevelForXP(playerXP[7])+"", 4034);
sendFrame126("@whi@"+getLevelForXP(playerXP[7])+"", 4035);

        playerLevel[8] = getLevelForXP(playerXP[8]);
sendFrame126("@whi@"+getLevelForXP(playerXP[8])+"", 4038);
sendFrame126("@whi@"+getLevelForXP(playerXP[8])+"", 4039);

        playerLevel[9] = getLevelForXP(playerXP[9]);
sendFrame126("@whi@"+getLevelForXP(playerXP[9])+"", 4026);
sendFrame126("@whi@"+getLevelForXP(playerXP[9])+"", 4027);

        playerLevel[10] = getLevelForXP(playerXP[10]);
sendFrame126("@whi@"+getLevelForXP(playerXP[10])+"", 4032);
sendFrame126("@whi@"+getLevelForXP(playerXP[10])+"", 4033);

        playerLevel[11] = getLevelForXP(playerXP[11]);
    sendFrame126("@whi@"+getLevelForXP(playerXP[11])+"", 4036);
    sendFrame126("@whi@"+getLevelForXP(playerXP[11])+"", 4037);

        playerLevel[12] = getLevelForXP(playerXP[12]);
    sendFrame126("@whi@"+getLevelForXP(playerXP[12])+"", 4024);
    sendFrame126("@whi@"+getLevelForXP(playerXP[12])+"", 4025);

        playerLevel[13] = getLevelForXP(playerXP[13]);
sendFrame126("@whi@"+getLevelForXP(playerXP[13])+"", 4030);
sendFrame126("@whi@"+getLevelForXP(playerXP[13])+"", 4031);

        playerLevel[14] = getLevelForXP(playerXP[14]);
sendFrame126("@whi@"+getLevelForXP(playerXP[14])+"", 4028);
sendFrame126("@whi@"+getLevelForXP(playerXP[14])+"", 4029);

        playerLevel[15] = getLevelForXP(playerXP[15]);
sendFrame126("@whi@"+getLevelForXP(playerXP[15])+"", 4020);
sendFrame126("@whi@"+getLevelForXP(playerXP[15])+"", 4021);

        playerLevel[16] = getLevelForXP(playerXP[16]);
sendFrame126("@whi@"+getLevelForXP(playerXP[16]), 4018);
sendFrame126("@whi@"+getLevelForXP(playerXP[16]), 4019);

        playerLevel[17] = getLevelForXP(playerXP[17]);
sendFrame126("@whi@"+getLevelForXP(playerXP[17]), 4022);
sendFrame126("@whi@"+getLevelForXP(playerXP[17]), 4023);

        playerLevel[20] = getLevelForXP(playerXP[20]);
sendFrame126("@whi@"+getLevelForXP(playerXP[20]), 4152);
sendFrame126("@whi@"+getLevelForXP(playerXP[20]), 4153);

}[/code]

That one is both stats white.
In your case, just change the @red@ to @whi@.

Hope that helped…
